parts.instructions: Complete Luke’s notes for his wife below. Use NO MORE THAN THREE WORDS AND/OR A NUMBER from the listening for each answer.

questions.prompt: Activities start at ______ a.m. - parents can drop their children off after 6.30 a.m.

parts.instructions: Complete the sentences below. Use NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS AND/OR A NUMBER from the listening for each answer.

questions.prompt: Green Trees can accommodate a maximum of ______ people.
Green Trees does not cater for caring for ______.
If residents communicate with Green Trees, they can arrange _______ to be prepared.
Green Trees tries to combine care and nursing with opportunities for residents to remain as _________ as possible.
Green Trees’ fees can be found in their leaflets or on the __________.

questions.prompt: Games Room Activieties' notes: A ________ is permitted to be invited - residents can meet new people.
All these above activities promote good condition in the __________ and lead to all sorts of other benefits.
Trips Away's notes: Only __________ trips arranged to prevent resident fatigue.
Gardening notes:__________ and makes residents feel in control.
Gardening notes: Can be dangerous, but training and ____________ are provided.

parts.instructions: Complete the summary below on the lecture on hypnosis, hypnotism and hypnotherapy. Write NO MORE THAN TWO WORDS from the listening for each answer.

questions.prompt: Hypnosis - a different psychological state of consciousness with increased potential for
Discussion: Hypnosis creates such relaxation that certain suggestions may be made to the ___________, bypassing the awake and logical part of the brain, so that therapy is possible.
The hypnotic trance allows increased ___________ to create beneficial changes.
This condition is different to normal states of consciousness, as alpha waves signify a special ___________.
This area receives stimuli from the ________ and passes on messages to the rest of the brain.
Using hypnotherapy can exploit people’s unknown ________ and help solve problems.
Some hypnotherapy requires little change in a patient, but more complicated behaviours require deeper therapy and psychological __________.
Choose THREE letters, A - G. According to the listening, why has hypnotherapy been criticised?
options: A. Because any practitioners are not properly qualified.
B. Because not enough research has been done to back up the results.
C. Because the relationship between hypnotherapy and improved patient results is not easy to prove.
D. Because current tests do not use a big enough sample of the population.
E. Because some tests have shown that hypnotherapy has only had an effect because the patients thought it would.
F. Because patients give positive responses when questioned in tests because they think they ought to.
G. Because of ignorance of hypnotherapy in the critics.
